title: Part (a)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe one potential negative environmental consequence from using nuclear power, such as one of the following.
The response describes one potential negative environmental consequence from using nuclear power, such as one of the following.

title: Part (b)(i)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

A response that describes reducing a negative consequence of using nuclear power does not earn a point.

Students must describe two different advantages to earn two points.
descriptions: The response does not describe a potential advantage of generating electricity using wind turbines, such as one of the following.
The response describes one potential advantage of generating electricity using wind turbines, such as one of the following.
The response describes TWO potential advantages of generating electricity using wind turbines, such as two of the following.

title: Part (b)(ii)
stimulusHtml: Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not describe one potential disadvantage of generating electricity using wind turbines, such as one of the following.
The response describes one potential disadvantage of generating electricity using wind turbines, such as one of the following.

title: Part (c)
stimulusHtml:
Select point value 1 to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and 2 to score the response.

The students must show their work for full credit. Students do not need to include units in the setup.
descriptions:
The response does not show the correct set up and does not have the correct final calculation.

One point is earned for the correct setup, as shown below.
